XI.ii.3.E.5.g
.
Distinguishing Between Accrued Lump Sum and Accrued Under 38 CFR 3.1000
In some instances, when accrued lump sum is payable, there will also be the possibility of an amount being payable as accrued involving that portion of the award which was in the course of payment or in suspense at the date of the Veteran’s death.
If a determination is made subsequent to the Veteran’s death that additional pension is payable, the additional benefit is payable as accrued subject to limitations contained in
38 U.S.C. 5121
.  The award of accrued lump sum is
not
affected by such posthumous action.
References
:  For more information on
basic entitlement to benefits under
38 U.S.C. 5121
, see
38 CFR 3.1000
reduction in benefits because of hospitalization in Old-Law Pension cases, see
38 CFR 3.551(b)
, and
hospitalization of competent Veterans, see
38 CFR 3.1001
.
